STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 6, 2024
Hope James
SAMARITAS - WEST
2080 UNION AVE SE STE A, Suite A
GRAND RAPIDS, MI, 49507-3247
RE: License#: CB410201266
Dear Hope James:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on September 3, 2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written
corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date
of this letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way, at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-3721
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CB410201266
Licensee Group Organization: Samaritas
Licensee Designee: Laura Louise Mitchell Pflug
Chief Administrator: Hope Elizabeth Mulder James
Name of Agency: SAMARITAS - WEST
Agency Address: 2080 UNION AVE SE STE A
Suite A
GRAND RAPIDS, MI 49507-3247
Agency Telephone #: 6163561934
Original Issuance Date: 08/01/1991
Service Types: Certify foster homes for license, Place
children in foster home, Supervise
Independent Living

II. METHODS OF INSPECTION
A. Consultant
Date(s) of On-site Inspection: 8/5/2024

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records
• (2) The personnel record must contain all the
following information before employment may
occur:
• (h) Documentation from the department
that the person has not been named in a
central registry case as the perpetrator of
child abuse or neglect in Michigan or in
any state where the person lived in the 5
years preceding hire.
One of seventeen employee files reviewed did not have an out of state central
registry clearance completed as required.
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home
certified by another agency the borrowing
agency shall have a record containing all the
following:

• (c) The initial evaluation and current
reevaluation.
One of two borrowed bed files reviewed did not have verification the borrowing
agency reviewed the initial evaluation and current evaluation prior to placing a
child in a foster home certified by another agency as required.
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
• (5) Within 15 days of the conclusion of the
evaluation, an agency shall complete a written
report that includes all the following information:
• (a) The date the information was
received.
One of three special evaluations reviewed did not have a written report completed
within 15 days of the conclusion of the evaluation as required.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
10/3/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 10/31/2023
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
• (1) An agency's medical and dental care policy
must, include all the following:
• (c) A physical examination for each child
as follows, unless a greater frequency is
medically indicated:
• (ii) A physical examination every
14 months.
One of eight foster care files reviewed did not have a medical examination
completed every 14 months as required.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
10/3/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 10/31/2023

CPA Rule 400.12415 Unusual incident reporting policy
• (1) An agency must adhere to the following
incident reporting protocols:
• (a) Immediately notify the child's parents;
the department licensing authority; the
lawyer guardian ad litem and court, as
applicable; the department; and the foster
child's parents, if any of the following
occurs:
• (ii) The foster child is absent
without legal permission.
One of eight foster care files reviewed, and one of six independent living files
reviewed did not have an incident report completed as required.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (2) An agency shall complete written service
plans for each child and parent or parents, as
follows:
• (b) Within 120 calendar days after the
initial removal and at least once every 90
calendar days thereafter.
One of six independent living files reviewed did not have a service plan
completed timely as required.
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting
FTM’s must occur within the required time frames as
outlined in the following tables:
Case Plan Development/Reassessment
Initial Case Plan (ISP) – within 30 calendar days before
the case plan due date.
Updated Case Plan (USP) – within 30 calendar days
before the case plan due date.

Permanent Ward Service Plan (PWSP) – within 30
calendar days before the case plan due date.
Placement Preservation/Disruption
At least three business days prior to a planned change
of placement or no later than three business days after
an unplanned change.
Planned and unplanned placement changes include
reunification, placement in a residential setting,
stepdown from a residential or hospital setting, return
from AWOLP, or request for change in foster
home/relative placements.
Six of eight foster care files reviewed did not have FTM's completed as required.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
10/3/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 10/31/2023
8/26/2022 RENEWAL, CAP approved 9/20/2022
FOM 722-06B FTM Documentation
The DHS 1105, FTM Report, must be completed for
every FTM.
The caseworker must enter the FTM information in
MISACWIS using the FTM hyperlink within seven
b usiness days of the FTM.
Six of eight foster care files reviewed and two of three independent living files
reviewed contained FTM's without the DHS 1105 or the DHS 1105 was not
uploaded within seven business days.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
10/3/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 10/31/2023
8/26/2022 RENEWAL, CAP approved 9/20/2022
FOM 722-06H Contact with parent or guardian when child is
placed out-of-home.
When a child has a permanency goal of reunification,
the case manager must have face-to-face contact with
legal parents and guardians as outlined in this section.
First Month after Initial Out-of-Home Placement

The case manager must have at least two face-to-face
contacts with the legal parent or guardian, with at least
one contact occurring at the parent or guardian’s home
or living environment, during the first month following
initial out-of-home placement.
Subsequent Calendar Months
The case manager must have face-to-face contact with
the legal parent or guardian at least once per calendar
month. At least one contact each quarter must occur in
t he parent’s residence.
One of eight foster care files reviewed did not have documentation the agency
made adequate attempts to contact and engage biological parent in the case
plan.
FOM 722-08 Supervisor approval
After the caseworker routes the service plan to the
supervisor for review and approval, the supervisor must
approve all case service plans within 14 days of the
end of the report.
Two of eight foster care files reviewed and one of three independent living files
reviewed did not have supervisory approval of the case service plan within 14
days as required.
FOM 722-08D Treatment Plans
When completed, obtain all signatures as appropriate,
including those of parent(s)/guardian(s), foster care
worker, supervisor, foster parent, caregiver, any youth
aged 14 and older and in the case of placment agency
foster care cases, the local DHS office designee.
Four of eight foster care files reviewed, and one of three independent living files
reviewed did not contain all of the required signatures on the parent agency
treatment plan (PATP).
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
10/3/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 10/31/2023
8/26/2022 RENEWAL, CAP approved 9/20/2022

FOM 801-03 Medical passports
For children entering foster care, the initial medical
passport must be provided within two weeks of the
child’s placement date to the following:
• Foster care provider
• Young adult voluntary foster care (YAVFC)
youth/young adult re-entering foster care.
The actual date the medical passport is provided must
be documented in the electronic case management
record.
All medical information within the medical passport
must be current and updated at least quarterly to reflect
the child’s current and complete health information.
An updated medical passport is provided to:
• Participating legal parent if the child is temporary
court ward.
• Quarterly, while in out-of-home placement.
• At reunification. Subsequent medical passports
are not required after reunification.
• Non-offending parent, subsequent medical
passports are not required after reunification.
• The child’s foster care provider at or prior to
each placement.
• All medical and mental health professionals to
whom the child is newly referred to and
accepted for treatment or services prior to or at
the first schedule appointment while the foster
care case is open, regardless of placement.
Subsequent medical passports are not required.
• Older youth/young adults.
• Upon initial independent living placement (youth
aged 16 and over).
• Upon exiting the foster care system (young
adults aged 18 and older).
• YAVFC youth/young adult.
Three of eight foster care files reviewed did not have medical passports and
required signatures.

REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
10/3/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 10/31/2023
8/26/2022 RENEWAL, CAP approved 9/20/2022
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (a) Child's name.
One of eight foster care files reviewed did not have documentation the caregiver
was provided youth's name prior to placement.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
10/3/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 10/31/2023
8/26/2022 RENEWAL, CAP approved 9/20/2022
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (b) Child's date of birth.
One of eight foster care files reviewed did not have documentation the caregiver
was provided youth's date of birth prior to placement.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
10/3/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 10/31/2023
8/26/2022 RENEWAL, CAP approved 9/20/2022
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:

• (c) Available known information about the
child's health.
One of eight foster care files reviewed did not have documentation the caregiver
was provided youth's known health information.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
10/3/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 10/31/2023
8/26/2022 RENEWAL, CAP approved 9/20/2022
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (d) Any known history of abuse or neglect
of the child.
One of eight foster care files reviewed did not have documentation the caregiver
was provided youth's known abuse/neglect history.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
10/3/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 10/31/2023
8/26/2022 RENEWAL, CAP approved 9/20/2022
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (e) All known emotional and
psychological factors relating to the care
of the child.
One of eight foster care files reviewed did not have documentation the caregiver
was provided youth's known emotional and psychological factors.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
10/3/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 10/31/2023

8/26/2022 RENEWAL, CAP approved 9/20/2022
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (f) All known behaviors of the child.
One of eight foster care files reviewed did not have documentation the caregiver
was provided youth's known behaviors.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
10/3/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 10/31/2023
8/26/2022 RENEWAL, CAP approved 9/20/2022
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (g) Circumstances necessitating
placement or replacement of the child.
One of eight foster care files reviewed did not have documentation the caregiver
was provided circumstances necessitating placement.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
10/3/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 10/31/2023
8/26/2022 RENEWAL, CAP approved 9/20/2022
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:

• (h) Any other known information to enable
the foster parent to provide a stable, safe,
and healthy environment for the foster
child and the foster family, including
information about siblings who do not
reside in the foster home as provided in
federal law.
One of eight foster care files reviewed did not have documentation the caregiver
was provided any known information to enable foster parent to provide a safe,
stable, and healthy environment for the foster child and the foster family including
any sibling information.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
10/3/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 10/31/2023
8/26/2022 RENEWAL, CAP approved 9/20/2022
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Include SOGIE in section 15 of licensing reports.
• Document sibling visits that were offered but not held and state the reason.
• Annotate on signature line of PATP if provided via email, mail, refused, etc.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There was 1 substantiated incident of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period. Special evaluation 2024SEC0001560 was initiated on 4/22/2024 regarding
allegations a licensed foster parent got into a "tussle" with a foster youth, grabbed the
youth by the arm after a household item was knocked over and made disparaging
remarks about the youth's mental health. The licensed foster parent was found to be
in violation of licensing rules. The evaluation was thorough and well written. A CAP
was developed, which foster parents refused to sign. As a result, revocation of the
foster home license was initiated.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The agency Interim inspection was completed on 10/3/2023 and the CAP was
approved on 10/31/2023. The agency was cited for 11 violations, 6 of which were
repeated this year. Of those 6, there was an improvement in individual incidents of
non-compliance within 2 of the violation areas (DHS 1105 and PATP) and a slight
increase in number of individual incidents in 1 area (FTM) and no change in the
remaining 3 areas (special evaluation report within 15 days medical appointment
and medical passport). In 2022, 15 violations were established, 6 of which were
repeated this year. All of the repeated violations remain close to the same number
of individual incidents of non-compliances. The agency will need to establish
additional corrective planning for the repeated violations to ensure a reduction of
incidents.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. The Chief Administrator
indicated the agency has a quarterly internal audit process that appears to have
increased compliance and consistency from the previous year. The assessment
noted the agency has struggled somewhat due to a high number of staff with
limited experience. The CA reported the agency dealt with a large number of
placement crises over the past year and staff demonstrated effective team work to
work together to address the crisis effectively. The CA reported she feels confident
the agency will continue to show improvement based on the processes in place.
Financial Overview
There were no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's audit.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Interviews were conducted with three staff via telephone. Staff reported
supervisors hold regularly scheduled supervision meetings and are available as
needed if issues/questions arise. In addition, coworkers assist as needed. Staff
reported communication is good overall, but some policy changes could be
communicated timelier. Staff reported no concerns or areas of need.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care and licensing services. All files were stored securely and
there is a cross shredder for CHRI.

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
________9/4/2024______________________
Melinda Gubbins Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
9/6/2024
_____________________________________
Samantha Way Date
Area Manager
